comments.text:

and I have to say, I agree with you. I think Christian loves Ana, but I 
don't think he would die for her...although he might possibly kill for her. 
There love just isn't as strong as the love shared between Gomez and 
Morticia. And even though Gomez and Morticia share 
a...unique...relationship as well, when they say I love you, it is 100% 
believable.

comments.author: Ishizu montoya

comments.text:
+FedralBI What a sweet story! That's so cool man, your dad's an example to

comments.author: Links Fraulein

comments.text:
I never truly knew how much my father loved my mother until I found his 
'little black book' in his desk at his work. Inside was every significant 
date of their relationship, all her sizes, the phone number of the closest 
florist to every job she had ever had and several poems that he had written 
about her. Other men had books of old girlfriend's phone numbers, my dad 
had a listing of all the places my mom wanted to visit and his plans on 
taking her to those places. Kids are too self centered to realize that 
their parents were 'real people' long before they were just mom and dad.
comments.author: FedralBI
